Frequently Asked Questions

Is the tree trout real?

The Rocky Mountain tree trout is a whimsical figment in the imaginations of the Tingle family.

Why is it endangered?

Habitat fragmentation, forest range shifts, and high-intensity fires threaten tree trout populations.

Where can I see one?

High-elevation pine/fir stands during the early mornings. Watch for movement in boughs near the apex of the tree and subtle branch jostling.

Does it leave the trees?

The tree trout’s life cycle includes seasonal migration between streams and trees. Coincidentally, tree trout migration influences the timing of peaks in nutrient redistribution and herbivore grazing.

How can I help?

Support stewardship groups, report sightings, and avoid disturbing boughs.

What about evolution?

Models suggest divergence from stream trout after the Pleistocene, with selection for vertical niches.

Is this just copying another site?

We are directly inspired by Lyle Zapato’s website Save the Pacific Tree Octopus. We honor these satirical conservation roots but emphasize forest ecology, folklore, and community action unique to the Rockies.
